--- title: "An Intro to Cloud Computing" description: | an interactive workshop on how to launch an Amazon EC2 instance author: - name: Samantha Csik url: https://samanthacsik.github.io/ orcid: 0000-0002-5300-3075 affiliation: Master of Environmental Data Science Program @ The Bren School (UCSB) & The National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis affiliation-url: https://ucsb-meds.github.io/ date: 2022-04-18 slug: csik2022cloudComputing categories: [MEDS, AWS] image: clouds.gif --- ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: :::
::: {.center-text} [{{< fa tv title="A television screen" >}} slides](https://ucsb-meds.github.io/cloud-computing/#1){.btn .btn-secondary role="button"} [{{< fa brands github title="Octocat, the GitHub logo" >}} source code](https://github.com/UCSB-MEDS/cloud-computing){.btn .btn-secondary role="button"} ::: # Abstract “The Cloud” is a buzzword we often hear, but maybe don’t quite understand. In this workshop, we’ll learn a bit about what cloud computing means and what it can look like, how to launch a virtual machine (i.e. an instance) using Amazon Web Services (AWS), and how we can leverage more powerful computers (e.g. the cloud) to run computationally-intensive processes in less time. # Audience This workshop was originally developed for the [Master of Environmental Data Science (MEDS) program](https://ucsb-meds.github.io/), administered by the [Bren School of Environmental Science & Management](https://bren.ucsb.edu/masters-programs/master-environmental-data-science) in partnership with the [National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis](https://www.nceas.ucsb.edu/).
